p:
Additionally, GMST warming has been shown to be associated with stratification of the Southern Ocean and a reduced propensity for the kind of sustained open-ocean convection that appeared to influence GMST variability in the preindustrial control run
23 . Indeed, the 2Ã—CO 2 run shows a reduction in Southern Ocean convection ( Supplementary Fig. 10e), latent heat flux ( Supplementary Fig. 9c), and sensible heat flux ( Supplementary Fig. 9d) associated with GMST variability.
